name: little weebee doll
yarn_weight: any gauge - designed for any gauge
sizes_available: any weight of yarn or hook can be used to create a larger or smaller doll
notes:
august 2017 update - i have amended the pattern so that little weebee more closely resembles his/her older sibling!  i hope you like the updated version of this little cutie!

little weebee works up fast, so makes a fantastic last minute gift or stocking filler

made using aran weight yarn and a 3mm hook and with my personal gauge little weebee stands at just under 5 inches tall. made from the toes to the top of the head in one go! only the arms need sewing on.

other yarn weights and hooks can of course be used to create smaller or larger dolls!

the following free clothing patterns are available for little weebee:
[bubble hem dress][1]
[removable mermaid tail][2]
[trousers][3] – to make a top to go with these, you can use the bodice from the above bubble hem dress

the following paid patterns are also available:
[wardrobe essentials part one][4] – contains 12 items of clothing & a hair cap
[wardrobe essentials part two][5] – contains 12 items of clothing & a hair cap

you can find my all of my weebee dolls and outfit patterns, in my ravelry store [here][6]. 

weebee is named after my youngest niece phoebe - when she was first born my daughter and phoebe’s older sister couldn’t say her name properly yet and she has been nicknamed ‘weebee’ ever since.

little weebee has the original weebee's trademark qualities, a wonderfully large head, shaped feet, hands with thumbs, a lovely round tummy and bottom - you’ll fall in love with little weebee i promise!

every effort has been made to ensure that this pattern is error free but i have very little time to spare (i have a three year old, lol!) so if you find any errors whatsoever in this pattern please do not hesitate to contact me and i will amend as soon as possible.

i hope you have as much fun crocheting your little weebee as i had designing the pattern!  more patterns to come!

remember to share your projects with us on the [weebee appreciation society facebook group][7]

if you have any questions or queries about this pattern please do not hesitate to contact me privately here or on facebook.
